metadata.title: USN-6968-3 -- PostgreSQL vulnerability
metadata.description: USN-6968-1 fixed CVE-2024-7348 in PostgreSQL-12, PostgreSQL-14, and PostgreSQL-16.  This update provides the corresponding updates for PostgreSQL-9.3 in Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and PostgreSQL-10 in Ubuntu 18.04 LTS.  Original advisory details:   Noah Misch discovered that PostgreSQL incorrectly handled certain  SQL objects. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute  arbitrary SQL functions as the superuser.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6968-3` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libecpg-compat3 - 10.23-0ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm2 libecpg-dev - 10.23-0ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm2 libecpg6 - 10.23-0ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm2 libpgtypes3 - 10.23-0ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm2 libpq-dev - 10.23-0ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm2 libpq5 - 10.23-0ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm2 postgresql-10 - 10.23-0ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm2 postgresql-client-10 - 10.23-0ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm2 postgresql-doc-10 - 10.23-0ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm2 postgresql-plperl-10 - 10.23-0ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm2 postgresql-plpython-10 - 10.23-0ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm2 postgresql-plpython3-10 - 10.23-0ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm2 postgresql-pltcl-10 - 10.23-0ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm2 postgresql-server-dev-10 - 10.23-0ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm2 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
